title: Date pickers
description: Date pickers let people select a date, or a range of dates.

contentChunks.htmlValue: There are three kinds of date pickers: docked date picker, modal date picker, and modal date input.

contentChunks.footer:
1. Docked date picker
  2. Modal date picker
  3. Modal date input
contentChunks.altText: 3 types of date pickers side-by-side. The docked date picker has an outlined text field above a calendar view. The modal date picker allows people to select a date from a calendar view. The modal date input lets someone type in a date

contentChunks.htmlValue: Resources

TypeLinkStatus
DesignDesign kit (Figma)Available
M2 guideline – Date pickersAvailable
ImplementationMDC-AndroidAvailable
Jetpack ComposePlanned
FlutterPlanned
WebPlanned
Takeaways

• Date pickers can display past, present, or future dates relevant to a task
  • Clearly indicate important dates, such as current and selected days
  • To ensure picking a day or time is intuitive, use common picker patterns, such as a calendar
What's new

• Color: New color mappings and compatibility with dynamic color
  • Types: The three types of date pickers have been renamed to not be device-dependent. The former desktop date picker is now known as the docked date picker. The former mobile date picker and date input are now known as modal date picker and modal date input to reinforce that the user must take an action.

contentChunks.footer: Modal date input, formerly known as a “mobile date input.”
contentChunks.altText: Modal date input that lets users type in a date

contentChunks.footer: M2: Date pickers had a drop shadow and different color mappings.
contentChunks.altText: Old version of a date picker with a white background and shadows

contentChunks.footer: M3: Date pickers have no shadow and new color mappings compatible with dynamic color.
contentChunks.altText: New version of date picker with a colorful background, rounded corners, and no shadows

contentChunks.footer: Docked date picker on desktop.
contentChunks.altText: date picker open on a form UI

contentChunks.htmlValue: Usage

Date pickers let people select a date or range of dates. They should be suitable for the context in which they appear.

Date pickers can be embedded into:
1. Dialogs on mobile
2. Text field drop-downs on desktop

contentChunks.footer:
1. Date picker dialog on mobile
2. Date picker text field dropdown on desktop

contentChunks.htmlValue:
There are three types of date pickers:
1. Docked date picker
2. Modal date picker
3. Modal date input

contentChunks.footer: 1. Docked date picker
2. Modal date picker
3. Modal date input

contentChunks.htmlValue: Docked date picker
Usage

Docked date pickers allow the selection of a specific date and year. The docked date picker displays a date input field by default, and a dropdown calendar appears when the user taps on the input field.Either form of date entry can be interacted with.

Docked date pickers are ideal for navigating dates in both the near future or past and the distant future or past, as they provide multiple ways to select dates.

contentChunks.footer: Docked date picker on desktop

contentChunks.htmlValue: Behavior
Dates can be added by using a keyboard or by navigating the calendar UI; both options are immediately available when the docked date picker is accessed.

contentChunks.footer: Docked date picker
Switching from a mobile calendar picker to a mobile date input picker
Switching from a mobile date range picker to a mobile date input picker

contentChunks.htmlValue: Month selection
Month selection can be navigated with the corresponding back and next arrows or by tapping the dropdown menu.

contentChunks.footer: Docked date picker month selection

contentChunks.htmlValue: Year selection
Year selection can be navigated with the corresponding back and next arrows or by tapping the dropdown menu.

contentChunks.footer: Docked date picker year selection

contentChunks.htmlValue: Modal date picker
Behavior

Mobile calendar pickers navigate across dates in several ways:

  • To navigate across months, swipe horizontally
  • To navigate across years, scroll vertically
  • To access the year picker, tap the year

Don’t use a modal date picker to prompt for dates in the distant past or future, such as a date of birth. In these cases, use a modal input picker or a docked date picker instead.

contentChunks.footer: Modal and docked date pickers are better suited for large screen over the direct input modal picker

contentChunks.htmlValue: Date range selection

Date range selection provides a start and end date.

Common use cases include:

  • Booking a flight
  • Reserving a hotel

Mobile date range pickers navigate across dates in several ways:

  • To select a range of dates, tap the start and end dates on the calendar
  • To navigate across months, scroll vertically

contentChunks.footer: Mobile date range picker

contentChunks.htmlValue: Modal date input
Usage
Mobile date input pickers allow the manual entry of dates using the numbers on a keyboard. Users can input a date or a range of dates in a dialog.

contentChunks.footer: Mobile date input picker
For dates that don’t require a calendar view, the mobile date input picker can be the default view
Alternatively, a text field with appropriate hint text can prompt for dates, such as in a form

contentChunks.htmlValue: Behavior
The date input picker can be accessed from any other mobile date picker, via the edit icon.

contentChunks.footer: Switching from a mobile calendar picker to a mobile date input picker
Switching from a mobile date range picker to a mobile date input picker

contentChunks.htmlValue: Compact devices
On small screens, such as mobile, a full-screen modal date picker is recommended to increase readability and touch target size. It can cover the entire screen on small screens

contentChunks.footer: A full-screen modal date picker on mobile

contentChunks.htmlValue: Medium and extended devices

The docked date picker displays a date input field by default, and a dropdown calendar appears when the user taps on the input field. The user can interact with either form of date entry.

Docked date pickers are ideal for navigating dates in both the near future (or past) and the distant future (or past), as they provide multiple ways to select dates.

contentChunks.footer: A docked date picker with a full calendar view is best used on larger devices

contentChunks.htmlValue: Selection
Selection is indicated through color, drawing visual attention. In date ranges, start and end dates are selected, while dates in-between appear connected with a subtle highlight.

contentChunks.footer: Differences between selected the selected date range (August 17–23) and today's date (August 5) are shown through color and fill

contentChunks.htmlValue: Appearing and disappearing

Like other kinds of dialogs, modal date pickers use an enter and exit transition pattern to appear on the screen. 

To exit a date picker, the input can either be confirmed (“OK”) or dismissed (“Cancel”). Interacting outside of the dialog will also dismiss the time picker. Unless one of these actions is taken, a time picker will continue to retain focus. Mobile full-screen pickers also have an additional close affordance (x) icon button and “save” confirmation.

The calendar view for docked date pickers appears just below the input field.

contentChunks.footer: Modal date pickers can be dismissed through interacting with content outside the dialog, or with the action buttons in the lower right.
Interacting with the input for a docked date picker makes the calendar view appear below.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Responsive layout
The sizing of the docked and modal date picker components don’t scale responsively.

contentChunks.footer: Don’t scale the date picker responsively to a larger size

contentChunks.htmlValue: Use cases

People should be able to:

  • Enter dates manually by inputting text, without using the picker
  • Use multiple input methods, making it accessible to those using assistive technology

On the Docked Date Picker, the text field can be used for input.
On Modal Date Picker, the input picker should be available from the calendar pickers via the edit icon.
Interaction & style

The edit icon indicates the ability to switch to the mobile input picker.

Interactive targets for all elements meet the 48x48dp minimum touch target requirement. Increasing density would negatively impact accessibility by limiting tappable/clickable targets.

contentChunks.footer: The edit icon indicates the ability to switch to the mobile input picker.
Touch targets are 48 x 48dp.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Date entry methods

The date entry component offers two ways to enter a date:

  • Direct text entry into a text field
  • Through the date picker

The calendar icon is the exclusive entry point for the date picker.

This improves efficiency for a screen reader and other keyboard users, as it makes interaction with the date picker optional and reduces the amount of key presses required to input a date.

Each input is a separate tab stop, which improves discoverability of the control.

contentChunks.footer: Entering a date either through direct text entry or the date picker.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Accessible date input

Automatically format the date after the user hits “Enter“ or navigates out of the text field.

Don't automatically format the date by adding slashes or other special characters while the user is typing (also known as input masks). This can cause confusion for people using screen readers because it changes what they typed. 

To reduce errors, accept a range of formats including dashes, spaces, slashes, dots, and 0 to the left of a single digit month/day. This is especially helpful for assistive technology users who might be more prone to errors when interacting with complex inputs.

contentChunks.footer: The text field's logic can adapt to the user's actual input format, applying the correct formatting after the user has completed their text entry.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Optional Clear button
If it's not needed for your use case, remove the Clear button from the screen to reduce the number of tab stops for keyboard users.

contentChunks.footer: Remove non-critical actions to reduce the number of tab stops for keyboard users.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Affordance for keyboard shortcuts

Ensure keyboard shortcuts are readily available for keyboard and screen reader users by providing the shortcut key in the tooltip. It should be included in the hint description to be read out by the screen reader.

As shown here, the previous year button is interactive and can therefore be focused via the keyboard. Upon focus, the tooltip explains the behavior of the button and shows the shortcut key.

contentChunks.footer: Keyboard tooltip example for date picker.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Truncated labels and tooltips

Truncating labels isn't ideal, but tooltips allow the full text to be shown on hover or keyboard focus.

Days of the week are not interactive and are therefore not focusable via keyboard, yet the tooltip is available on hover. The date picker relies on the conventionality of these abbreviations for some assistive technology users.

contentChunks.footer: Days of the week are not navigable via keyboard and so the tooltip is shown only on pointer hover.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Color contrast between dates
Dates should meet contrast requirements of 4.5:1 between the link text colors and the background.

contentChunks.footer: Dates pass 4.5:1 contrast ratio requirement.

contentChunks.htmlValue: Keyboard navigation

Keys
Actions
Enter/returnEnter/return
Enter/returnCloses the calendar and saves the selected date
Page up/downMove to the same date on next/previous month
Home/End    Move to the first day of the month
Shift + Page up/downMoves to the same date in the next/previous year
Shift + MMoves to the month list dropdown
Shift + YMoves to the year list dropdown
Labeling elements

The text field's accessibility label should clearly state the purpose of the input (for example, event date or reservation date) and should match the placeholder text when the field is empty.

The helper text (below the text field) should specify the date format (for example, MM/DD/YYYY or YYYY/MM/DD) and act as a description for the text field. The default helper text is "MM/DD/YYYY," but this can be customized.

contentChunks.footer: The accessibility label clearly states the type of input as an event date.

contentChunks.htmlValue:
Element
A11y label
Role
Previous / next month and year“{label}”Button
Month and year dropdowns“{label}”Button
Days of the weekColumn header
Month gridGrid
Screen reader verbalizations
To support screen reader users, labels are used to enumerate the complete date. This ensures screen reader users hear the full context of "Monday, August 17” instead of just part of the date.

contentChunks.footer: Screen readers will state the full day, month, date, and year instead of just the number 17.
